message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.MM

This paper describes a segmentation technique for brain MR images using Markov random fields. The technique involves capturing nonparametric distributions of tissue intensities, neighborhood correlations, and signal inhomogeneities, which are all relevant to computer vision and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves simulations and real MR images, which could fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of simulated annealing and iterated conditional modes could also fall under cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.MM (Multimedia).
